abstract: Seeking to satisfy European antitrust officials, Microsoft said on Thursday that it would open up and share many more of its technical secrets with the rest of the software industry.
snippet: Seeking to satisfy European antitrust officials, Microsoft said on Thursday that it would open up and share many more of its technical secrets with the rest of the software industry.
lead_paragraph: Seeking to satisfy European antitrust officials, Microsoft said on Thursday that it would open up and share many more of its technical secrets with the rest of the software industry and competitors.

headline.main: Microsoft to Share More Technical Secrets

abstract: EMC has bought Pi Corporation, a startup founded by the former Microsoft executive Paul Maritz that is working on Web-based software. The company doesn’t have a product yet, but it looks likely to help EMC get into so-called cloud computing.
snippet: EMC has bought Pi Corporation, a startup founded by the former Microsoft executive Paul Maritz that is working on Web-based software. The company doesn’t have a product yet, but it looks likely to help EMC get into so-called cloud computing.
lead_paragraph: EMC, the big computer storage company, bought a little Seattle start-up on Thursday for an undisclosed price. Still, the deal and the forces behind it are intriguing indeed.

headline.main: EMC Acquisition Shows It Wants to be a Cloudmaster

abstract: As both Microsoft and Yahoo gird themselves for a potentially drawn-out fight, Microsoft is giving a pep talk to its foot soldiers.
lead_paragraph: As both Microsoft and Yahoo gird themselves for a potentially drawn-out fight, Microsoft is giving a pep talk to its foot soldiers.

headline.main: Microsoft’s Internal Yahoo Memo to Its Troops

abstract: In a letter to employees, Kevin Johnson, president of Microsoft’s platform and services division, said the challenges of integrating Microsoft and Yahoo are not insurmountable — that is, if the two companies do indeed merge.
snippet: In a letter to employees, Kevin Johnson, president of Microsoft’s platform and services division, said the challenges of integrating Microsoft and Yahoo are not insurmountable — that is, if the two companies do indeed merge.
lead_paragraph: We can do it. We can mesh our technologies and our cultures. And we’ll keep the Yahoo name alive.

headline.main: Microsoft President on Micro-Hoo: We Can Do It
